page.title: 19CALDECOTE BRIDLEPATHS
page.content:
{BRIDLEPATHS}- THESE ARE PUBLIC RIGHTS OF WAY FOR HORSES, PEDESTRIANS AND CYCLISTS.
BRIDLEPATH TO HARDWICK. - THIS IS SIGNPOSTED AT ROAD NEAR JASON FARM KENNELS. IT IS A VERY PLEASANT WALK IN DRY WEATHER,ALTHOUGH THE SHORT STRETCH ALONGSIDE HARDWICK WOOD SEEMS TO STAY MUDDY ALL YEAR ROUND. DURING THE WINTER THE WHOLE WALK CAN BE RATHER MUDDY, THIS SITUATION BEING AGGRAVATED BY HORSES USING THE PATH. THE FIRST SECTION OF THE WALK IS ALONGSIDE PASTURE AS FAR AS HARDWICK WOOD, THEN THROUGH ARABLE FIELDS. THERE ARE GOOD VIEWS TOWARDS TOFT AS THE RISE NEAR HARDWICK IS REACHED, FIELDS STRETCHING AS FAR AS THE EYE CAN SEE. { {CONT PAGE 20 .
